lbfgsb

Class StopConditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • lbfgsb.StopConditions

  • public class StopConditions
extends java.lang.Object
    Stop conditions for the algorithm. Each stop condition is associated with a flag that determines if the stop condition is active. See descriptions of set... methods for explanation of each of the conditions meaning.
    Author:
    Mateusz Kobos

    • Method Detail

      • getFunctionReductionFactor

        public double getFunctionReductionFactor()

      • setFunctionReductionFactor

        public void setFunctionReductionFactor(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - relative function reduction factor.

        Cite from the original L-BFGS-B fortran code:

        The iteration will stop when (f^k - f^{k+1})/max{|f^k|,|f^{k+1}|,1} <= factr*epsmch where epsmch is the machine precision which is automatically generated by the code.

        Example values for 15 digits accuracy:

        • 1e+12 for low accuracy,
        • 1e+7 for moderate accuracy,
        • 1e+1 for extremely high accuracy

      • isFunctionReductionFactorActive

        public boolean isFunctionReductionFactorActive()

      • setFunctionReductionFactorInactive

        public void setFunctionReductionFactorInactive()

      • getMaxGradientNorm

        public double getMaxGradientNorm()

      • setMaxGradientNorm

        public void setMaxGradientNorm(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - maximal acceptable gradient value The iteration will stop when $||proj g||_{\infty} <= value$ where $proj g$ is the projected gradient.

      • isMaxGradientNormActive

        public boolean isMaxGradientNormActive()

      • setMaxGradientNormInactive

        public void setMaxGradientNormInactive()
